Title: Vcenter Process Memory Tampered
Description: Vcenter to Switch: If Vcenter is given access to memory, such as shared memory or pointers, or is given the ability to control what Switch executes (for example, passing back a function pointer.), then Vcenter can tamper with Switch. Consider if the function could work with less access to memory, such as passing data rather than pointers. Copy in data provided, and then validate it.

Title: Replay Attacks
Description: Vcenter to Switch: Packets or messages without sequence numbers or timestamps can be captured and replayed in a wide variety of ways. Implement or utilize an existing communication protocol that supports anti-replay techniques (investigate sequence numbers before timers) and strong integrity.

Title: Collision Attacks
Description: Vcenter to Switch: Attackers who can send a series of packets or messages may be able to overlap data. For example, packet 1 may be 100 bytes starting at offset 0. Packet 2 may be 100 bytes starting at offset 25. Packet 2 will overwrite 75 bytes of packet 1. Ensure you reassemble data before filtering it, and ensure you explicitly handle these sorts of cases.

Title: Collision Attacks
Interaction: "ESXi or Harvester" to BS (Backup and Restore) Solution
